name: Sebel's Picross
overview: A German language PICROSS clone created by Sebastian Beloch aka Sebel. It is a a nonogramme puzzle game. The player is presented with a grid, surrounded by numbers on the top and left sides. These numbers represent the number of squares on that row or column that shall be filled. On a 5x5 grid, a number five means that the entire row or column should form a straight line across the grid, whereas the numbers ”2, 1” on the left mean that that row should have one line of 2 filled squares and another shorter line of 1 square. These lines must have at least one blank square to separate them. Using deduction, it is possible to fill in all the right squares when viewed holistically.
